title: Global-e Shares Fall 27% After Reporting 1Q Results, Cutting Revenue Guidance

contentObject.content: Shares of Global-e Online Ltd. were lower in Monday's late trading session, after the eCommerce company reported first-quarter financial results and said it was lowering its fiscal year 2022 revenue guidance.

After the bell, the company reported a first-quarter loss per share of 35 cents on revenue of $76.3 million. In the year-ago period, the company reported a loss per share of 8 cents on revenue of $46.2 million.

The company also said it was expecting second-quarter revenue in a range of $82.5 million and $84.5 million. Global-e also said it cut its view for fiscal year 2022 revenue to a range of $383 million and $403 million, from earlier guidance of a range between $411 million and $421 million.
At 5:44 p.m. EDT, the company's shares were trading 27.27% lower at $13.95 per share. Volume at the time topped 936,000 shares.
The stock finished the day's regular session with a 6.26% loss at $19.18 per share.
The stock touched a 52-week low of $15.87 per share on May 12.
Write to Stephen Nakrosis at stephen.nakrosis@wsj.com
